name: wrangled
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
wrangle
to argue with someone about something, especially for a long time: They had been wrangling with the authorities about/over parking spaces. The two companies are still wrangling over the details of their proposed collaboration.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter weeks of wrangling in Florida, George Bush emerged as the 43rd President of the United States. Government, environmentalists, and utilities wrangle over how to cut pollution from the nation's power plants.They wrangled about whether companies should be required to treat stock options as a business cost.
